intro: Melolobium wilmsii, commonly known as the Wilmsii melolobium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has compound leaves and produces pods that contain edible seeds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
